psycho I'm not sure about visio.
You can extract kmsnano to a subdirectory ex: kmsnano_v11

You could then run the Activate_Office2013.cmd as administrator.  I have no idea if this will fix your problem, or if visio just simply starting requiring people to register things online.  You're not going to have any problems doing such a thing unless you run a large business and are trying to pirate all office versions. Then you could run into trouble, but I don't see MS taking everyone to small claims court over office activation fees.

You guys are definitely getting me curious about Office 2013.

On the office issue vidyarathe, can you please tell me which operating system you are using? win7 32bit or win8 32bit? Ultimate? Pro? Home Basic? stuff like that...

Also what method are you using to try to activate? Your picture shows kmseldi in the background. Are you running the activate_office2013 script as admin? Please give me more info as the screens you show just give error messages that operating systems give and I don't know how you are trying to activate.

In the meantime, I can recommend doing an admin command "SFC /SCANNOW" that will clean up any bogus system files.

Also, what activation methods are you using? Did you use Windows Loader for windows activation? Did you use removewat?

firebender, I don't think that the oem pre-installed 3.0 licenses work the same way. I'm pretty sure Daz has said that he won't pursue a windows 8 version using the oem loading method.

For Office people, try running admin command prompt command "SFC /SCANNOW" and then try starting qemu with that manual start and then try running the kmseldi program and just activate office 2013. Make sure the IP address for the emulated system matches... should be either 127.0.0.1 or 127.0.0.3

I am not the guy who released this software. The guy is heldigard and his work is based on someone else's over at MDL forums.  I wish I knew as much as those guys do about office activation stuff.

I bet there's some sort of office licensing script like there is for windows that you can set to the default office volume key and point it at an online kms server and just activate with a few commands.  I just don't know what it is though...  I have a few more all-in-1 windows releases to work on, but then I'll start messing with office kms activation to help people with better advice.

As far as re-activation.  You don't need to wait to re-activate windows.  You can re-activate at any time, as many times as you want.  If you use microsoft servers or online kms servers they will start to block the keys, but kmsnano doesn't save any settings.  It resets the key charge lists every time you start the program.

vidya, the pastebay file you listed does not mention any Office product key.  Did you try entering one from some sort of keygen or something when you installed?  I mention this because all KMS activation uses the exact same keys and if you set it to something else, and the office activation thing doesn't reset it, it won't activate your non-kms key.

I think maybe you should try running the script inside kmsnano for Activate_Office2013 as administrator.  That, I believe, will set the key for you before it activates.

vidya I believe I read somewhere that for office, you have to remove the registry keys and such after it is uninstalled because it won't remove them by default.  There are some programs out there that can clean up the registry and other files orphaned when you uninstall things.  I know windows 7 and windows 8 manager have great uninstall features that search for extra bits and registry keys left behind.  You might try getting the appropriate one of those and remove office, then let it clean up the junk files and old registry keys.

When that is done, try installing without setting a key. Or if that isn't possible, search for the kms key for office 2013 (It's always the same key for kms)

I believe the key might be in the activate_office2013.cmd script
Just edit that and look for the key.
You should not need to do that unless it absolutely requires a key to install. I haven't used it yet as I am very busy, so I'm a bit new about it still.

Hope that helps bud
